thread.title: Kyle Chandler to Star in 'Godzilla' Sequel | Hollywood Reporter
thread.title_full: Kyle Chandler to Star in 'Godzilla' Sequel | Hollywood Reporter

title: Kyle Chandler to Star in 'Godzilla' Sequel | Hollywood Reporter
text:
3:31pm PT by Rebecca Ford Kyle Chandler to Star in 'Godzilla' Sequel Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty 'Stranger Things' actress Millie Bobby Brown also will star in the film. 
Bloodline star Kyle Chandler has joined the Legendary and Warner Bros.' Godzilla sequel. 
Stranger Things star Millie Bobby Brown also is attached to Godzilla: King of the Monsters, which is part of the Legendary and Warner Bros. cinematic universe. It is slated for release on March 22, 2019. 
Michael Dougherty is directing from a script by Dougherty and Zach Shields. 
Plot details are being kept locked on a South Pacific island but Chandler will play a scientist and father of Brown's character. The role makes him ostensibly the hero of the movie. 
The first film in the franchise was released in 2014 and was directed by Gareth Edwards. It earned $529.1 million worldwide. 
Chandler, who won an Emmy award and received multiple nominations for his role as Coach Eric Taylor on Friday Night Lights , currently stars in Netflixâ€™s Bloodline , for which he received two Emmy nominations for his role as John Rayburn. He was most recently seen in Manchester By the Sea with Casey Affleck. 
Chandler was fielding multiple offers for feature gigs but opted for the Godzilla sequel, nabbing a seven figure deal in the process, according to sources. 
He is repped by Gersh and Brillstein Entertainment Partners.
